extremelyActive.title: Extremely Active
extremelyActive.description: Very hard exercise daily or physical job

selfCare.title: Self-Care Reminder
selfCare.content: Make sure to stay hydrated and get plenty of rest as your body prepares for ovulation.

general.sleepTip: Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep each night for optimal hormone balance.
general.hydrationTip: Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily to support overall health and reduce bloating.

menstrual.title: Menstrual Phase Tips
menstrual.content: Focus on rest and gentle movement. Iron-rich foods can help replenish what's lost during menstruation.
menstrual.nutritionTip: Include iron-rich foods like leafy greens, lentils, and lean meats to combat fatigue.

follicular.title: Follicular Phase Tips
follicular.content: Your energy is increasing! This is a great time for starting new projects and physical activities.
follicular.exerciseTip: Your body responds well to cardio and strength training during this phase.

ovulatory.title: Ovulatory Phase Tips
ovulatory.content: You may feel more confident and social now. This is your most fertile time if you're trying to conceive.
ovulatory.socialTip: This is a great time for important conversations and social events.

luteal.title: Luteal Phase Tips
luteal.content: Energy may decrease as progesterone rises. Focus on completing tasks rather than starting new ones.
luteal.selfCareTip: Gentle yoga and meditation can help manage PMS symptoms during this phase.

phases.menstrualDescription: The shedding of the uterine lining
phases.ovulatoryDescription: Release of an egg from the ovary
phases.lutealDescription: Rising progesterone and preparation for implantation

log.title: Log Your Cycle
log.saveSuccess: Your log has been saved successfully!

profile.title: Profile
profile.resetWarning: This will permanently erase all your cycle history and personal information. This action cannot be undone.
